contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which no one can measure or count" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: which cannot be measured or counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Where God said to them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It will be that where it was said to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will say to them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be said to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will gather them together" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has shown you compassion" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the people used to clothe themselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: were used to cover her nakedness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "are dying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])

This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My people are perishing because you, the priests, have not properly taught them about me so that they will obey me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: My people are being destroyed because of the lack of knowledge

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have set a time of harvest for you also, Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For you also, Judah, a harvest has been appointed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but the result will be that I will destroy the people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but it was only so they might be cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Assyrians will carry them away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be carried to Assyria

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Assyrians will destroy the king of Samaria" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])

This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Assyrians will destroy Israel's high places, where the people acted very wickedly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The high places of wickedness will be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The more I called them to be my people, the more they refused me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The more they were called, the more they went away from me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Here "name" represents the entire character of God. Alternate translation: "is his name to which we pray" or "is his name by which we worship him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: is his name to be called on

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the wind blows away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that is driven by the wind away

contextId.occurrenceNote: These phrases can be put into the active voice. Alternate translation: "the enemy will dash their young children to pieces, and they will rip open the pregnant women" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their young children will be dashed to pieces, and their pregnant women will be ripped open
